Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian pottery Type B kantharos; white slip; interior: glazed (fired red and worn) with two added white bands; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ8
Curator's comments: Φ8 is written in pencil on the sherd's interior surface. Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis (Williams 1983, 169). According to Williams (1983, 184 note 53), the sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1924,1201.832. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 168, no. 127)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 726, no. 852)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1757) (phase 2)
